title: Chapchar Kut
hero_image_alt: Mizo dancers performing traditional bamboo dance
short_description: Bamboo Harvest Festival of Mizoram - a vibrant celebration of dance and community.
long_description: Chapchar Kut is a spring festival held once the demanding work of clearing bamboo forests for shifting cultivation (jhum) is complete, giving farmers time to relax and celebrate. It is one of Mizoram’s biggest cultural events, symbolising gratitude for nature and community unity. Chapchar Kut is a perfect entry point into Mizo culture, with almost everything—dance, music, food, and clothing—on display in one festival. For travellers, Aizawl during Chapchar Kut feels like a living cultural showcase, yet remains friendly and small‑scale compared with more commercialised festivals elsewhere.
significance: Celebrates the completion of the arduous task of 'jhum' (slash and burn) operation, marking a season of relief and joy.
key_rituals: Cheraw Dance: The iconic bamboo dance where performers step in and out of moving bamboo poles.
Khuallam: 'Dance of the Guests', traditionally performed by distinctively dressed groups.
Chheih Lam: A community dance where singing and dancing go hand in hand.
Public Feasting: Traditional dishes and community gatherings in Aizawl's main grounds.

top_places.title: Aizawl
top_places.summary: The AR Ground in Aizawl hosts the main state-level celebration with thousands of participants.
top_places.how_to_reach: Fly to Lengpui Airport (AJL), near Aizawl.

practical_info.dress_tips: Casual comfortable wear. Locals wear colorful traditional 'Puan' wraps.
practical_info.safety_tips: Aizawl is very hilly; wear comfortable walking shoes. It is one of the safest cities in India.
practical_info.accessibility_notes: Hilly terrain can be difficult for those with mobility issues.

faqs.q: Do I need a permit for Mizoram?
faqs.a: Yes, an Inner Line Permit (ILP) is required for Indian tourists, and registration for foreigners.
Mizo cuisine is meat-heavy, but Aizawl has restaurants serving vegetarian options.
